metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26769 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability found in Liblouis Lou_Trace v.3.24.0 allows aremote attacker to cause a denial of service via the resolveSubtablefunction at compileTranslationTabel.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblouis-bin - 3.20.0-2ubuntu0.2
liblouis-data - 3.20.0-2ubuntu0.2
liblouis20 - 3.20.0-2ubuntu0.2
python3-louis - 3.20.0-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: liblouis package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20.0-2ubuntu0.2').
